poem:
Title: Casting Results into Taiwan's Wind 

Upon the isles of jade and mist,
Millions cast a thundering twist,
In reckoning of East and West,
A president dons the quest.
Shadows of superpowers linger,
Yet radiances of hope sings in the shiver,
A world held captive in a single stake,
On Taiwan's strength and promise we partake.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Taiwan election: who are the candidates and what is at stake? In a bumper year of elections, a small archipelago of 24 million people will take part in a presidential vote that will have far-reaching consequences. On 13 January, voters in Taiwan will choose a new president, who will set the tone for relations between the world’s two biggest superpowers for the years to come. Related: Taiwan braces for ‘big deal’ presidential election as China’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
